text: For kayaking around on calm, near-shore waters, you don’t need a pile of gear. If you’re paddling to a faraway destination, though, our checklist is a handy way to ensure you don’t forget any essentials. Your preferences, abilities and conditions dictate what you leave off or add to your final list.
label: n

text: Note that we've already integrated the Ten Essentials into this list. If you're planning on camping overnight, also see our Backpacking Checklist for items you'll need in camp.
label: n

text: Headlamp or light with extra batteries
label: y

text: Maps and charts in waterproof case
label: y

text: Items below are in-boat wear; adjust according to anticipated air and water temperatures. Read What to Wear Kayaking for an overview.
label: n

text: Swimwear or shorts or convertible pants
label: y

text: Rashguard top or moisture-wicking T-shirt or long-sleeve shirt
label: y

text: Spray jacket or rain jacket and pants
label: y

text: Dry suit or top or wetsuit or top
label: y

text: Matches or lighter or fire starter in waterproof container
label: y

text: Snacks like energy food or lunch
label: y

text: Cellphone in protective bag or case
label: y

text: Trip itinerary left with friend, in boat + under car seat
label: y

text: Toilet paper or sanitary wipes and sanitation trowel
label: y

text: Hand sanitizer or biodegradable soap and ziplock waste bag
label: y
